title: Chennai Super Kings
summary: Founded in 2008, The Chennai Super Kings (CSK) is an Indian franchise cricket team based in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, which plays in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

image.license: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported license.

value.label: M.A.Chidambaram Stadium is a cricket stadium in Chennai. The stadium was established in 1916 and it is the third oldest cricket stadium in India.

image.altText: Image of M. A. Chidambaram Stadium

value.label: During the first player auctions for the inaugural IPL season conducted in January 2008, the Chennai franchise bought a number of contemporary star cricketers such as Mahendra Singh Dhoni, Matthew Hayden, Stephen Fleming, Muttiah Muralitharan and Michael Hussey. In the 2008 season, they made it to the finals, losing to Rajasthan Royals. In the 2009 season, they were knocked out in the semifinals.

Chennai secured their first ever IPL title, beating Mumbai Indians in the final by 22 runs. They then defeated the Chevrolet Warriors at the final of the CLT20 tournament in Johannesburg to become the first IPL team to win the CLT20.

In the 2011 season, Chennai won all their home games that season becoming the first team in IPL to achieve the feat. They then defeated Royal Challengers Bangalore in the final to win their second consecutive title in the IPL.

In the 2012 season, they were defeated by Kolkata Knight Riders in the final, and were denied a hat trick of titles.

In the 2013 season, they were defeated by Rajasthan Royals in the semi finals.

In the 2014 season, they crashed out of the IPL, but, on account of finishing third, qualified for the main event of the 2014 CLT20 tournament and defeated IPL champions Kolkata Knight Riders in the finals to receive their second CLT20 title.

In the 2015 season, they lost against Mumbai in the final.

After serving a two-year suspension from the IPL starting July 2015 for the alleged involvement of their owners in the 2013 IPL betting case, the Super Kings returned to the league in 2018, winning the championship in the comeback season, its third overall.
